alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gilchrist, central Alachua and south central Columbia Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over High Springs, or 13 miles southwest of Worthington Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Alachua, High Springs, Fort White, University Of Florida, Gainesville Airport, Rochelle and Newnans Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
